title: Static description file for the build details of Python installations

schema_version.description: Schema version. This is a constant value and MUST be ``1``. Future iterations of this schema MUST update this value.

base_prefix.description:
Base prefix of the Python installation.

Either an absolute path, or a relative path to directory where this file is contained.

language.description:
Object containing details related to the Python language specification.

In addition to the required keys, implementations may choose to include extra keys with implementation-specific details.

version.description: String representation the Python language version â€” a version string consisting only of the *major* and *minor* components.

implementation.description:
Object containing details related to Python implementation.

This section SHOULD be equivalent to :py:data:`sys.implementation`, but only the ``name`` and ``version`` keys are actually required to be present.

name.description: Lower-case name of the Python implementation.

version.description: Object in the format of :py:data:`sys.version_info`, containing the implementation version.

interpreter.description:
Object containing details Python interpreter.

If the Python installation does not provide an interpreter, this section will be missing.

path.description: The path to the Python interprer. Either an absolute path, or a relative path to the path defined in the ``base`` key.

abi.description: Object containing details related to ABI.

flags.description:
Build configuration flags, used to calculate the extension suffix.

The flags MUST be defined in the order they appear on the extension suffix.

extension_suffix.description: Suffix used for extensions built against the current implementation version.

stable_abi_suffix.description: Suffix used for extensions built against the stable ABI.

suffixes.description: Valid module suffixes grouped by type.

libpython.description:
Object containing details related to the ``libpython`` library.

If the Python installation does not provide a ``libpython`` library, this section will be missing.

dynamic.description:
The path to the dynamic ``libpython`` library.

Either an absolute path, or a relative path to the path defined in the ``base`` key.. If the Python installation does not provide a dynamic ``libpython`` library, this entry will be missing.

static.description:
The path to the static ``libpython`` library.

Either an absolute path, or a relative path to the path defined in the ``base`` key.. If the Python installation does not provide a static ``libpython`` library, this entry will be missing.

link_to_libpython.description: Should extensions built against a dynamic ``libpython`` link to it?

c_api.description:
Object containing details related to the Python C API, if available.

If the Python implementation does not provide a C API, this section will be missing.

headers.description: The path to the C API headers. Either an absolute path, or a relative path to the path defined in the ``base`` key..

pkgconfig_path.description: The path to the pkg-config definition files. Either an absolute path, or a relative path to the path defined in the ``base`` key..

arbitrary_data.description:
Object containing extra arbitrary data.

This is meant to be used as an escape-hatch, to include any relevant data that is not covered by this specification.
